definition: lit. to reverse the rotation of the sky/fig. to reverse a desperate situation
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation
unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation

sentences.english: I don't want to call you "hero", but also helpless.
sentences.chinese: 我不想称你“英雄”，但也无无力回天。

sentences.english: I am not the sort of female to torment a respectable man. Please understand that I cannot accept you.
sentences.chinese: 当一个女的不喜欢一个男的，真是回天无力阿。

sentences.english: Face first touchdown, no turning back.
There was no hope for Spitz now.
sentences.chinese: 斯皮兹现在是回天乏术了。

sentences.english: As Barack Obama appears to pull ahead, what options remain for John McCain?
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马遥遥领先，麦凯恩无力回天？

sentences.english: This is your only way to compensate for less sleep.
sentences.chinese: 那是治愈缺少睡眠的回天之术。

sentences.english: So the balance is clined seriously. my left hand failed.
sentences.chinese: 于是天平严重倾斜，大势已去，我的左手回天乏术。
雪花可有回天乏力之术？

definition: to return/to go back/to come back
to fall/meteor/to perish/see also 殞|殒[yun3]
to be reborn/to recover/to come back to life/to regenerate
mystery known only to heaven (archaic)/inscrutable twist of fate/fig. top secret
great emptiness/the void/heaven/the skies/universe/cosmos/original essence of the cosmos
the Yellow Springs/the underworld of Chinese mythology/the equivalent of Hades or Hell
to peel with a knife/old variant of 戮[lu4]
